main event: Multiple sightings of a flying disc were reported in San Bernardo, Santiago, and Valparaiso, Chile in March 1950.
interesting points: The first sighting occurred on 11 March in Punta Arenas, with many witnesses describing extreme altitude and a silver ping-pong ball shape., The second sighting in the Santiago area was reported on 24th and 25th March with similar descriptions., A third sighting happened on 28 March between 1330 and 1410 over Santiago, with locals observing the phenomenon., An observer from a nearby air base initially noted the speed and altitude of the object., Local authorities later concluded that a stationary object observed was Venus, countering claims of the flying disc.
